cookies.title: Cookies Policy
cookies.intro: At danielvargas.dev, privacy and transparency are fundamental principles. This policy explains how browser storage technologies are used, including the current and potential future use of cookies and local storage.

1.title: 1. What are cookies?
1.content: Cookies are small text files that a website can store in the user's browser. Their main purpose is to remember certain information about the visit, such as browsing preferences or login data. Some cookies are deleted when the browser is closed (session cookies), while others remain stored for a set period (persistent cookies).

2.title: 2. What is local storage?
2.content: Local storage, also known as localStorage, allows websites to save data directly in the user's browser. Unlike cookies, local storage has greater capacity and does not expire automatically.

3.title: 3. What technologies are used on this site?
3.content: Currently, no cookies are used on danielvargas.dev. The site uses local storage solely to remember the user’s preferred language (key: i18nextLng), without collecting personal data or sharing information with third parties.

4.title: 4. Google Analytics
4.content: This site uses Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to gather statistical information about website usage. Interactions are tracked through anonymous events. No data is shared with Google for advertising or product improvement purposes.

5.title: 5. Potential future use of cookies
5.content: In the future, new functionalities might require the use of first-party or third-party cookies for technical or analytical purposes. No advertising cookies will be used without the user’s explicit consent.

6.title: 6. Managing cookies
6.content: Most browsers allow users to accept, block, or delete cookies. It is recommended to consult the official documentation of your browser for more information on how to control cookies and/or local storage.
